articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets Singaporean Delegation
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets Singaporean Delegation
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun met and had a talk with the delegation of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Singapore led by Permanent Secretary Bilahari Kausikan who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Friday.

articles.title: Talks between Delegations of DPRK and Singaporean Foreign Ministries Held
articles.content:
Talks between Delegations of DPRK and Singaporean Foreign Ministries Held
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegations of the DPRK and Singaporean foreign ministries took place here on Friday.
					 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were officials of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs including Vice-Minister Kung Sok Ung and from the Singaporean side members of the delegation of the  Ministry of Foreign Affairs led by Permanent Secretary Bilahari Kausikan.
					
					 At the talks both sides informed each other of the situation in their countries and exchanged views on boosting the friendly relations between the two countries and issues of mutual concern.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Meets Singaporean Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Meets Singaporean Delegation
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a talk with the delegation of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Singapore led by Permanent Secretary Bilahari Kausikan who paid a courtesy call on him on Friday. 
					 The head of the delegation said he was struck with admiration at great progress the DPRK has made in various fields.
					
					 The relations between the two countries are developing on good terms, he said, expressing his will to boost bilateral support and cooperation in the regional and international arenas in the future, too.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets President of Turkish Red Crescent
Turkish Red Crescent Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Turkish Red Crescent Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- Ahmat Lutfi Akar, president of the Turkish Red Crescent, and his party visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, on Friday.
					 They looked round the historic relics preserved at the old home of the President, being briefed on the revolutionary career of the President who was born in a straw-thatched house.
					
					 At the end of the visit he said:
					
					 I was deeply impressed to visit the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 It is a time-honored place where an endless crowd of people are visiting.
					
					 Kim Il Sung will always be alive in the hearts of mankind.

articles.title: Performances Held to Mark Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Election as General Secretary of WPK
articles.content:
Performances Held to Mark Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Election as General Secretary of WPK
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) --Art  performances were sponsored by working people's organizations on Friday to commemorate the 15th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					 Among the audience were Ri Yong Su, department director of the C.C., the WPK, Kim Jin Ha, secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, officials of working people's organizations, students, workers and members of trade unions, agricultural workers and members of the women's union.
					
					 Poem reciting and singing events were held by youth and students in Pyongyang at the Central Youth Hall. Put on the stage were such colorful numbers as poem "Jubilation in October" and chorus "Glory to Our Great Party".
					
					 The performers in their numbers impressively represented the fact that the election of Kim Jong Il as general secretary of the WPK provided a guarantee for the eternal prosperity of the nation and opened up a rosy future of the Korean revolution.
					
					 A performance was given by the Workers' Art Group of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea at the Central Workers' House.
					
					 Put on the stage were dialogue poem "You Are Our Mother", female vocal trio "Strong Yearning" and other numbers.
					
					 The performers highly praised Kim Jong Il for performing undying exploits by developing the WPK, a Juche-oriented party, into a powerful guiding force for the Songun revolution.
					
					 Serial of songs "Do Prosper, Era of the Workers' Party", "The Best Country" and "Lets' Go Cheerfully" deeply impressed the audience.
					
					 A performance was given by the art group of the C.C., the Union of Agricultural Workers at the Cultural House in Kwaksan County, North Phyongan Province and solo presentation and solo performance were given by members of the women's union at the Women's House in Pyongyang. The performers vividly represented the fact that thanks to the wise leadership of the WPK developed by Generalissimo     Kim Jong Il, the nation's dignity and honor would shine forever and a rosy future of the country be guaranteed.

articles.title: Delegation of Federal Emigration Bureau of Russia Visits Statues
articles.content:
Delegation of Federal Emigration Bureau of Russia Visits Statues
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Federal Emigration Bureau of Russia headed by Deputy Director Anatoli Kuznetsov visited the equestrian statues of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il at the Mansudae Art Studio on Friday.
					 They laid bouquets before the statues before paying tribute to them.

articles.title: Chinese Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Chinese Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Ministry of Agriculture of China led by Vice-Minister Niu Dun visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, on Friday.
					 At the old home of the President the guests looked round the historic relics, being briefed on the undying revolutionary history of Kim Il Sung and his patriotic and revolutionary family members in Mangyongdae.
					
					 The head of the delegation said at the end of the visit:
					
					 Kim Il Sung was an ardent revolutionary and patriot who devoted his all to the country and people.
					
					 The Chinese people are boundlessly revering him, outstanding leader.
					
					 The Sino-DPRK friendly relations provided by him would grow stronger.
					
					 The delegation also visited Panmunjom, Rungna Dolphinarium, etc.

articles.title: Egyptian Guests Visit Pyongyang Children's Foodstuff Factory
articles.content:
Egyptian Guests Visit Pyongyang Children's Foodstuff Factory
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- Chairman and CEO Naguib Sawiris of the Orascom Telecom Media and Technology Holdings SAE of Egypt and his party visited the Pyongyang Children's Foodstuff Factory on Thursday.
					  They looked round processes for the production of bean-flour drink, being briefed on the modern factory.
					
					  Meanwhile, they toured the Rungna Dolphinarium.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- Maurice Cukierman,  international secretary of the Central Committee of the French Revolutionary Communist League, and a delegation of the GermanÔºçKorean Friendship Parliamentary Group led by Chairman Stefan Muller arrived here on Friday.
					 On the same day, Ahmat Lutfi Akar, president of the Turkish Red Crescent, and his party and the delegation of the Federal Emigration Bureau of Russia headed by Deputy Director Anatoli Kuznetsov departed here.

articles.title: KPA Servicepersons Determined to Implement Supreme Commander's Order
articles.content:
KPA Servicepersons Determined to Implement Supreme Commander's Order
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- Servicepersons in the DPRK play the pivotal role in the drive to build an economic power and improve the people's livelihood.
					 Upon receiving an order of Kim Jong Un, supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, they started another project for the improvement of the Hapjang River on Oct. 2.
					
					 In this regard KCNA met soldier-builders who have turned out in the project with the fixed will to implement the Supreme Commander's order in time.
					
					 Jang Jong Ho, a KPA officer said:
					
					 "Respected Marshal Kim Jong Un ordered us, servicepersons, to carry out the Hapjang River improvement project. This is an expression of his absolute trust in us. He put forward the KPA as the reliable pillar of the Songun (army-first) revolution.
					
					 The project will be finished at a stretch by the servicepersons full of the spirit of devotedly defending the leader and implementing his order to the last."
					
					 Ji Ryong Bin, a soldier, said:
					
					 "It is our unshakable determination and will to implement any order of the respected Supreme Commander without fail.
					
					 We will exert ourselves to finish the project as scheduled, picturing in mind the images of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk."
					
					 Kim Jin Ok, a soldier, said:
					
					 "I will fully display the revolutionary soldier spirit in this project, following the great patriotic devotion of the Supreme Commander.
					
					 The world will see again how the servicepersons implement the order of Marshal Kim Jong Un, flying high the flag of the Workers' Party of Korea."

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Pro-Reunification Patriotic Fighter
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Pro-Reunification Patriotic Fighter
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un sent a birthday spread to Kim Yong Su, a pro-reunification patriotic fighter, on Friday, his 80th birthday.
					 He was born in a tenant's family with sorrow over being a member of the stateless nation. Living in the south after the country's liberation, he ardently longed to see the north where people were leading a happy life under the care of President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 After coming to the DPRK during the Fatherland Liberation War, he bravely fought with arms in his hand for the party and the leader, the country and its people. He devoted himself to the socialist construction after graduating from a university in the post war period.
					
					 He was arrested by the enemies while struggling for national reunification. He did not yield to all sorts of appeasement and brutal torture aimed to force him to make an ideological conversion during several decades-long prison life.
					
					 Kim Yong Su who received the birthday spread, his family members and relatives renewed their will to dedicate their all to the struggle for the country's prosperity and national reunification, cherishing the love and trust shown by the Marshal.

articles.title: DPRK Women's Soccer Team Advances into Semifinals
articles.content:
DPRK Women's Soccer Team Advances into Semifinals
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- The DPRK team trounced its Canadian rival 2:1 in the 2012 U-17 Women World Cup Thursday. 
					 It will advance into semifinals.

articles.title: Dance Drama "Story of Sado Castle" Staged in DPRK
articles.content:
Dance Drama "Story of Sado Castle" Staged in DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- Nowadays the dance drama "Story of Sado Castle" has been staged by the National Folk Art Troupe at the People's Theater here.
					 The drama gives a portrayal of the patriotic Korean people who fought against invaders during the period of the Three Kingdoms (Koguryo, Paekje and Silla). 
					
					 It breaks into five acts, eight scenes and epilogue.
					
					 In the drama Kum I (female lead), daughter of the lord of Sado Castle, meets fisherman Sun Ji (male lead) for the first time when they simultaneously let off arrows at one pheasant in a fine spring day, and they fall in love.
					
					 But their love faces setback by A Han, a warrior escort of the lord, who had an eye to Kum I.
					
					 Meanwhile, Sun Ji's native village is invaded by Japs, who slaughtered inhabitants and looted their properties, and Sado Castle is placed at the crucial moment of its fall.
					
					 A Han surrenders to the enemy. But Kum I and Sun Ji, together with inhabitants, heroically fight the invaders to defend the castle and their love matures into a marriage.
					
					 The dance drama is highly acclaimed for the successful presentation of the Koreans' wisdom and bravery and diverse customs through traditional dance movements.
					
					 This drama was created fifty years ago by Choe Sung Hui, a famous dancer, who played a leading role in it. The drama was recreated last year to commemorate her 100th birth anniversary.

articles.title: 500th Performance of Light Comedy "An Echo among the Hills" Given
articles.content:
500th Performance of Light Comedy "An Echo among the Hills" Given 
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- The 500th performance of light comedy "An Echo among the Hills", Kim Il Sung Prize laureate, was staged at the National Theatrical Theater on Friday before full house.
					 Among the audience were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Hong Kwang Sun, minister of Culture, An Tong Chun, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of the Unions of Art and Literature, creators, artistes, media persons and people in the city.
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il said that the light comedy "An Echo among the Hills" produced early in the 1960s still has great vitality though half a century has passed since its production. And he instructed the National Theatrical Troupe to reproduce the comedy and perform it before full houses.
					
					 After watching the comedy for the fourth time in March last year, he expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the creators and artistes of the troupe staged the comedy 303rd times, something unprecedented in the history of literature and arts, and assigned it the task to stage it 500 times in the future.
					
					 The comedy has been staged in Pyongyang and provincial capitals including Kanggye, Hamhung, Wonsan, Phyongsong, Haeju and Hyesan for little over two years, mesmerizing audiences.
					
					 More than 400,000 service personnel of the Korean People's Army and people have watched the comedy.
					
					 Watching the comedy which vividly and truthfully represents a farm village at that time with laughter and witty humor, audiences clearly realized the noble spiritual world, lofty idea and indomitable fighting spirit of the people in the era of Chollima who raced against time with patriotic devotion to the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Pyongyang Floriculture Institute
articles.content:
Pyongyang Floriculture Institute
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Floriculture Institute is a center for breeding good species of flowering plants and establishing their scientific cultivation methods to be introduced to all parts of the country.
					 Over the last one year the Institute has been renewed. Its plottage grew 11 times, the cultivation area 14 times and flower output more than 20 times, as compared with those in the previous year.
					
					 It has modern greenhouses whose processes are based on computer control system, experimental plots and advanced bio-engineering facilities. The double vacuum glass greenhouses are designed to ensure the cultivation of flowers in all seasons.
					
					 Various species of flowers grown in its experimental plots are enough to satisfy the demand of citizens and give a facelift to streets and residential quarters of Pyongyang.
					
					 After General Secretary Kim Jong Il's visit to it in March last year, the Institute bred 20 odd new species of flowers, including cymbidium, Gerbera xhybrida hort and Cylamen persicum, collected nearly 180 species of flower genes and completed the method of propagating flowers through tissue culture.
					
					 Among the new species of flowers is Manbokhwa, named by the dear respected Kim Jong Un. Manbokhwa, an evergreen perennial plant, belongs to orchid family and blooms for a long time.
					
					 The Institute succeeded in acclimating tulip and other species of flowers grown in other countries to the climate and soil conditions of Korea and produced flowering plant based on gene transition for the first time in the country through transplantation of drought-resistant gene to a leaf cell of all-season chrysanthemum and its tissue culture. In this way it laid a foundation for producing various species of flowering plants as wished.
					
					 It also brought out books "Illustrated Book of Flowers" and "Flower Bed, Flowerpot Making and Floriculture".
					
					 Recently a flower wholesale house was built at the Institute, which is always crowded with many customers.
					
					 On display there are more than 70 species of flowers growing in Korea and different parts of the world, including Impatiens walleriana, Bromeliaceae, Celosia plumose and Cyclamen persicum Mill, rare flowers.
					
					 The house sells floral baskets and bouquets, flowerpots and vases of various shapes.
					
					 Jang Pok Hwa, chief of the Institute, told KCNA that it would mass-produce beautiful and rare flowers conducive to the people's cultural life.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Blasts Lee Myung Bak's Anti-DPRK Remarks
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Blasts Lee Myung Bak's Anti-DPRK Remarks
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak in "policy speech" at the "National Assembly" dared hurt the social system in the DPRK again, talking about the "quality of life of citizens" and "human rights".
					 He even let loose such rubbish that "north's nuclear and missile development threaten the security of not only the peninsula but of the world."
					
					 This rubbish of the man more dead than alive is nothing but the desperate fit of a confrontational maniac.
					
					 In the DPRK the leader, the people and army are advancing full of vitality toward hopeful morrow in close unity in single mind. This is the true picture of the DPRK and its social system.
					
					 As recognized by the international community, a signal progress made by the DPRK for the promotion of the people's wellbeing and the building of an economic power has won the admiration of the world.
					
					 Die-hard traitors who have steeped in confrontation awareness and repugnance of the fellow countrymen can not see this.
					
					 By raising a hue and cry over the "threat" from the DPRK in his "policy speech", the traitor gave vent to his anger as he was beaten hard by the might of the single-minded unity and of Songun of the DPRK during his tenure of office.
					
					 His political destiny has reached the extreme point for his huge crimes.
					
					 He, censured by the nation for the total bankruptcy of the domestic and foreign policies, is being forsaken internally and even by his American and Japanese masters. This is his wretched plight.
					
					 Even though he is just a short way away from being dumped to the garbage ground of history, the traitor is still pulling up the other. This shows his wicked nature.
					
					 More serious is that he let the "prime minister" make the speech, fearing that he may be beaten to death.
					
					 Lee, ignorant of the country and the nation and without any knowledge of philosophy and his own view, disclosed his wretched plight in the "speech".
					
					 He said that "he looks forward to the south-north relations of common existence and prosperity" and that "he has no intent to achieve reunification by absorption". This was just a last resort aimed to evade his responsibility for having plunged the north-south relations to the complete deadlock by pursuing vicious confrontation policy.
					
					 At the outset of his office the traitor said that "he is ready to let the south-north relations remain in the frozen state till the end of his office".  
					
					 He totally denied and systematically stroke down the common idea of the nation and its achievements for the past several years.
					
					 In active pursuance of the U.S. and Japanese masters' hostile policy toward the DPRK, the traitor tried hard to bring about a "regime change" and provoke a new war, while crying out for "unification under the liberal democratic system" throughout his tenure.
					
					 Due to the traitorous regime's confrontation policy, the north-south relations have taken up the confrontation structure worse than that in the Cold War period. The Korean Peninsula, a cradle of life of the Korean nation down through generations, turned into the world's biggest hotspot where a nuclear war may break out any moment.
					
					 The south Korean newspaper Hangyore once carried the article titled "Poodle of the U.S." in which it said that "Lee Myung Bak approached the south-north relations from the Cold War perspective, insisting on 'high-handed approach toward the north' and 'south Korea-U.S. alliance' without any philosophy and principle. This provoked a big laughter. The engineering work and diplomacy as well as the south-north relations are all locked in the '1970's mode'". This irony perfectly fitted the traitor.
					
					 Lee Myung Bak faces only disgraceful ruin just as the preceding traitors of the nation met miserable ends.
					
					 So pitiful is the fate of the traitor who still makes nonsensical remarks on his lonely journey to the other world.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Implementing North-South Declaration
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Implementing North-South Declaration
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- 5 years ago, the north and the south of Korea reconfirmed the spirit of the June 15 joint declaration and adopted the October 4 declaration to develop the inter-Korean relations and achieve peace and prosperity. The declaration clarifies all the fundamental matters of expanding and developing the inter-Korean relations on the basis of the June 15 joint declaration.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday in a bylined article says in this regard:
					
					The October 4 declaration serves as a practical program and action guidelines for the north and the south to fully embody the June 15 joint declaration by pooling their will and efforts in the idea of "By our nation itself".
					
					 Had the October 4 declaration been steadily implemented along with the June 15 joint declaration, the inter-Korean relations would have been put on a high level of development, the peace on the Korean Peninsula consolidated and, accordingly, the day of national reunification, a cherished desire of all Koreans, been hastened.
					
					 Nevertheless, the inter-Korean relations were frozen all of a sudden due to the U.S. and its lackeys the south Korean Lee Myung Bak puppet regime though they had once favorably developed and a touch-and-go situation is prevailing on this land where the desire for national reunification was growing stronger, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The present deplorable situation of the inter-Korean relations clearly shows that it is impossible to achieve national reconciliation, unity and peace and peaceful reunification and prosperity common to the nation if the June 15 joint declaration and October 4 declaration are disregarded and their implementation is denied. 
					
					 The prevailing situation calls on the Korean nation to make a clean sweep of the Lee group of traitors in order to preserve and implement the north-south declarations.
					
					 The Koreans' cause of national reunification advancing along the road indicated by the north-south joint declaration despite challenges of the anti-reunification forces is sure to be accomplished, concludes the article.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Developing National Education, Culture and Arts
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Developing National Education, Culture and Arts
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- It is one of the important requirements of the non-aligned and other developing nations for building an independent new society to rapidly develop national education, culture and arts, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in a bylined article.
					 Only when the people, masters of society, are trained as independent and creative beings by strengthening education and developing culture and arts, is it possible to rapidly develop society and achieve prosperity of the country and nation, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 In the past the imperialists and colonialists invaded many countries in Asia, Africa and Latin America to deprive them of their political sovereignty and perpetrate economic plunder. 
					
					 Moreover, they enforced policies of stamping out national education, culture and arts and keeping people in ignorance.
					
					 Consequently, national culture and arts were trampled down and corrupt Western life style and culture prevailed in non-aligned and other developing countries.
					
					 Their people became illiterates and were left far behind in terms of social life.
					
					 They should, therefore, tap all their potentials, help each other and exchange their experience on the principle of complementing one another under the banner of collective self-reliance.
					
					 It is essential for collectively fending off the infiltration of the imperialists' reactionary ideology and culture to strengthen South-South cooperation in national education, culture and arts.
					
					 It is the consistent policy of the DPRK to boost the South-South cooperation.
					
					 The DPRK will make every possible effort to develop South-South cooperation in education, culture and arts on the principle of effecting collective self-reliance, complementing one another and ensuring equality and mutual benefit.

articles.title: South Korean Warmongers' Reckless Remarks Ridiculed
articles.content:
South Korean Warmongers' Reckless Remarks Ridiculed 
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak of south Korea in a recent commemoration of "the Day of 'ROK' Army" talked rubbish that "Northeast Asia is facing a challenge as the north refuses to halt the nuclear and missile development".
					 Kim Kwan Jin, minister of Defense, while inspecting the 2nd Fleet Command of the navy in Phyongthaek, Kyonggi Province, blustered that the north may perpetrate a provocation in an area utterly unimaginable by way of trumpeting in the east and attacking in the west, kicking up war hysteria.
					
					 Jong Sung Jo, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff of the south Korean puppet army, touring units on the front, cried out for "strongly reacting against any provocation on the spot," seizing it as an opportunity of actions. 
					
					 Minju Joson Friday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 These outpourings reveal the warmongers' carefully worked out scenario to seek a way out in the provocation of a war against the DPRK.
					
					 The commentary cites facts to prove that Northeast Asia has turned into the most unstable region in the world due to the U.S. strategy for hegemony and the moves of its lackeys Japanese reactionaries and the Lee Myung Bak group.
					
					 A war has not yet broken out on the Korean Peninsula, the world's biggest hotspot, thanks to the DPRK which has bolstered up its war deterrent for self-defence.
					
					 The Lee group's moves to ignite a war against the DPRK would lead it to self-destruction.

articles.title: Serious Environmental Pollution in S. Korean Army Bases
articles.content:
Serious Environmental Pollution in S. Korean Army Bases
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed that soil around the bases of the south Korean puppet army is seriously contaminated by all sorts of life-threatening oil and chemical substance, sparking public concern.
					 A lawmaker from the Democratic Unified Party, an opposition party of south Korea, revealed the fact on Tuesday.
					
					 A survey made of the contaminated soil around 13 bases last year indicated that the oil and chemical substance which contaminate 11 bases were far beyond the tolerance level.
					
					 Poisonous substance discovered in a base of Hwachon, south Korean Kangwon Province, in particular, was more than 20 times the tolerance limit and xylene more than 56. 3 times the tolerance limit was detected in another base.
					
					 Besides, it was reported that leakage of chemical substance including carcinogenic and toxic substance from many bases is creating the danger of contaminating even underground water.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Nepalese Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Nepalese Paper
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- The Nepalese newspaper Jana   Sata on September 29 carried a gist of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Workers' Party of Korea Is the Party of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung."
					 The paper carried a portrait of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The work made public on October 2, 1995 clarifies that the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) is a glorious party which explored a new way of building a revolutionary party in the era of independence and set an example in it.
					
					 It indicates tasks to be fulfilled to develop the WPK into an eternal glorious party of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Anniversary of Passing of Kim Jong Suk Commemorated in Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Anniversary of Passing of Kim Jong Suk Commemorated in Democratic Congo
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition and a lecture took place in Kinshasa of Democratic Congo on September 17 on the occasion of the 63rd anniversary of the passing of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese war hero.
					 Displayed in the venue of the photo exhibition were photos on the undying feats of the woman commander of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The national secretary in charge of International Relations of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Democratic Congo said at the lecture that Kim Jong Suk was born in a patriotic family and participated in the sacred war for the liberation of the country in her early years.
					
					 She participated in the armed struggle till the country's liberation after joining the Korean People's Revolutionary Army commanded by President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 She protected Kim Il Sung at the risk of her life in many battlefields during the period of the hard-fought anti-Japanese war.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk successfully carried out the revolutionary tasks assigned to her by Kim Il Sung at all times, the national secretary said, and went on.
					
					 She displayed mysterious marksmanship and trained guerrillas as fighters possessed of ardent love for the country and its people and indomitable faith by setting a practical example in the van of guerrillas at all times.
					
					 She visited different parts of the country after the liberation of the Korea and powerfully aroused the people to the building of a new country, true to the intention of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Her noble life always shines along with the prosperity of socialist Korea.

articles.title: Myanmar, Nigerian Figures Laud WPK
articles.content:
Myanmar, Nigerian Figures Laud WP
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- Myanmar and Nigerian figures released statements on Sept. 26 and 27 on the occasion of the 15th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and its 67th founding anniversary.
					 Aung Thein Lynn, member of the Central Executive Committee of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar, said that President Kim Il Sung's founding of the WPK on October 10, 1945 marked a great event in the development of the Korean revolution.
					
					 The WPK has developed into an ever-victorious iron-willed party under the wise guidance of Kim Il Sung and eneral Secretary Kim Jong Il, he noted, and went on:
					
					 Under the correct leadership of the WPK the Korean people became the most independent and creative people in the world and the DPRK emerged a powerful country with single-minded unity and nuclear deterrent.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the DPRK, is developing the WPK into an invincible guiding force and wisely leading the Party and people to the building of a thriving nation and national reunification.
					
					 Alhassan Mamman Muhammad, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, praised Kim Jong Il for his exploits performed in party building.
					
					 Kim Jong Un formulated the WPK as the glorious party based on Kimilsungism and Kimjongilism which struggles for embodying Kimilsungism and Kimjongilism.
					
					 The WPK will demonstrate its might as a powerful party steadily advancing along the road of Juche as it has Kim Jong Un at its head.

articles.title: Bangladeshi Organization Supports WPK's Stand on Improving Inter-Korean Relations
articles.content:
Bangladeshi Organization Supports WPK's Stand on Improving Inter-Korean Relations 
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- The Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee issued a statement on Sept. 28 on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of the historic October 4 declaration.
					 The adoption of the declaration was an event of great significance in the history of the Korean nation's movement for reunification, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The declaration is winning great support from all Koreans as it serves as a practical programme for fully embodying the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 The inter-Korean relations have been brought to the lowest ebb and a touch-and-go situation is prevailing on the Korean Peninsula due to the south Korean authorities keen to escalate confrontation with fellow countrymen, opposed to national reconciliation, unity and reunification.
					
					 The committee extends invariable support and solidarity to the stand of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the government of the DPRK to improve and develop the inter-Korean relations by thoroughly implementing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.

articles.title: Nepalese Figures Support October 4 Declaration
articles.content:
Nepalese Figures Support October 4 Declaration
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- Phanindra Raj Pant, secretary general of the Nepalese Association for Supporting the Songun Politics who is co-secretary general of the Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Committee of Nepal, made public a statement on Sept. 27 on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of the historic October 4 declaration.
					 He expressed hope that the Korean people would achieve great success in their struggle for independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 People of Nepal and all other countries loving independence, progress and peace fully support the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and its action programme October 4 declaration, he said.
					
					 He bitterly denounced the U.S. for refusing to abide by the resolution of the 30th UN General Assembly which calls for disorganizing the "UN Forces Command" and withdrawing foreign forces from south Korea.
					
					 Korea will surely be reunified under the banner of the above-said declarations, he noted, and went on:
					
					 In order to achieve peaceful reunification of Korea the south Korean authorities should promptly opt for respecting the inter-Korean declarations, pull out the U.S. nuclear weapons and aggression forces from south Korea and stop all kinds of joint military exercises.
					
					 We strongly call for pulling down the concrete wall and abolishing the "Security Law" in south Korea.
					
					 All Korean people loving peace and justice will surely achieve country's reunification, a cherished desire of the nation.

articles.title: Hugo Chavez Vows Stronger Socialist Drive
articles.content:
Hugo Chavez Vows Stronger Socialist Drive 
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez in his recent address pledged to redouble his efforts to create a socialist system.
					 "We've laid the foundations of 21st century socialism and today we launch, well, the second cycle," Chavez said, adding "We'll launch the second socialist cycle, from 2013 to 2019, with much more strength."

articles.title: Widespread Protest against Ospreys' Deployment in Japan
articles.content:
Widespread Protest against Ospreys' Deployment in Japan
 Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- Inhabitants in Ginowan City, Okinawa Prefecture of Japan staged a protest against the deployment of Ospreys of the U.S. forces.
					 Members of civic organizations and people of various strata were involved in the protest staged around the Futenma U.S. air force base.
					
					 The protesters blocked the entrances to the military base with their vehicles in strong protest against the implementation of the plan to deploy Ospreys.
					
					 It was reported that there was a clash between protestors and U.S. servicemen and that Japanese civilians stood in confrontation with GIs with wire fences in between.

articles.title: Rubricado protocolo entre Corea y Rusia
articles.content:
Rubricado protocolo entre Corea y Rusia
Pyongyang, 5 de octubre (ACNC) -- Quedo firmado este viernes en esta capital el protocolo de la 3a reunion del grupo de expertos comunes para resolver los asuntos alusivos a la ejecucion del convenio sobre las actividades de trabajo provisional de los ciudadanos de otro Estado en el territorio de un Estado unilateral entre los gobiernos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y de la Federacion Rusa.
					  En la ceremonia de firmas estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana el viceministro de Comercio Exterior, Ri Myong San y otros funcionarios y por la rusa, los miembros de la  delegacion del Buro de Emigracion Federal de Rusia encabezada por su subdirector Anatoli Kuznetsov y el embajador ruso en Corea, Alexandr Timonin.

articles.title: Tienen lugar conversaciones entre cancillerias de RPDC y Singapur
articles.content:
Tienen lugar conversaciones entre cancillerias de RPDC y Singapur

articles.title: Celebran aniversario de eleccion de Kim Jong Il como Secretario General
articles.content:
Celebran aniversario de eleccion de Kim Jong Il como Secretario Genera
Pyongyang, 5 de octubre (ACNC) -- Las organizaciones de masas ofrecieron el dia 5 las funciones artisticas por el 15o aniversario de la eleccion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il como Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					Disfrutaron los espectaculos el jefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea Ri Yong Su, el secretario del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang Kim Jin Ha, los funcionarios de las organizaciones de masas, los jovenes y estudiantes, los obreros, los miembros de la Federacion General de los Sindicatos de Corea y la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea y los trabajador agricolas.
					
					En la Casa Central de la Juventud tuvo lugar el recital de poesia y cancion de los jovenes y estudiantes de esta ciudad, ocasion en la cual se presentaron la poesia "Jubilo de octubre", el coro "Gloria a nuestro gran partido" y otras piezas.
					
					Los ejecutantes describieron que gracias a la eleccion del Dirigente como Secretario General del PTC, se dio la garantia de la prosperidad eterna de la nacion y se abrio el horizonte prometedor de la revolucion coreana.
					
					Se realizo la funcion del grupo central de propaganda artistica del CC de la Federacion General de los Sindicatos de Corea en la Casa Central de Obreros.
					
					Se presentaron en la escena la poesia en dialogo "Usted es mi madre", el trio femenino "Anoramos"  y otras piezas.
					
					Los ejecutantes alabaron las imperecederas hazanas del Dirigente quien desarrollo el PTC, partido del tipo jucheano, como poderosa fuerza orientadora de la revolucion del Songun.
					
					La serie de canciones "!Que prospere la epoca del Partido del Trabajo!" y "Vamos con risas" y etc. conmovieron mucho a los espectadores.
					
					En la funcion del grupo central de propaganda artistica de la Union de Trabajadores Agricolas de Corea, que tuvo lugar en la casa cultural del distrito de Kwaksan de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte, y en el recital de las gremiales de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea, efectuado en la casa de mujeres de la ciudad de Pyongyang, los ejecutantes destacaron que brillan eternamente la dignidad y el honor de la nacion gracias a la sabia direccion del PTC.
